Reviews.Title: “Reliably great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: peanutsNewYork
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times before and know that this is a well kept and comfortable property. The rooms are extremely clean and we love the outdoor pool and spa to relax in the afternoon and morning. As long as there are no races at the Speedway or other huge events, the rates are very reasonable. They also have a free shuttle that takes you within two miles to the airport, shopping or restaurants. The staff is welcoming and offer exceptional service, from Courtnery at the desk, to the driver, Randy. You won't be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: steve p
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the speedway so the rooms are not available during racing events, unless you book way in advance and pay close to 500 a night, Other than that the hotel is very clean nice rooms within walking distance of the speedway, volusia mall, several restaurants, and for those that enjoy a good walk in the morning a two mile walking lot around the Daytona Speedway. Nice location 5-10 to beach 2-3 to Emory Riddle and 2-3 to the I-95/I-4 junction.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cutiemommy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel from 14 hours drive, too early for check in time, but Dee the front desk allowed us to checked in early. She was so nice and very friendly! The hotel was great, clean and very comfortable beds! Night Auditor, Tanveer was very nice and friendly. Gorgeous front desk " Courtney" is an asset to the company! Greg, was nice too! all the staff including the housekeeper and houseman, they're all friendly! I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: LindaBeckenham
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a lovely welcoming reception where cookies and fruit were in the reception area. The desk manager was very welcoming and the hotel felt clean, welcoming and bright and airy. We went to our room which was huge with big comfortable beds. Breakfast was not included by they did not charge for our 5 year old and when they realised I did not have hot cooked breakfast and only toast the lady said she would not charge me either! There is a business centre with free Internet access, printer and paper/envelope supplies. There is also a laundry room which we used to save taking dirty clothes home. The real bonus is that this hotel is right opposite Volusia Mall, so if you are even only passing through, it's a great place to nip out and do some shopping before you head off again. What a delight, service great, facilities great, rooms great, price reasonable - could not ask for more. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, solid airport hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Susie1473
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel for a quick stay in Daytona after a flight. It is located next to a wide variety of restaurants and practically attached to both the airport and the racetrack. Clean, friendly service, and easy check-in and check-out. Comfortable bed, decent sized bathroom, and large room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Keep an Eye on Your Stuff!”
Reviews.Author: TWJ_11
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property, good restaurant, convenient to the track, and overall has a very pleasant staff. However, as a frequent traveler to Daytona who has always preferred Hilton Gardens, I was deeply disappointed when I left a jewelry case -- a very large hanging one! -- in the room, and the housekeeping staff did not turn it in. They know who cleaned the room, they know who inspected the room behind the housekeeper, but no one was held accountable in any way. So I would not hesitate to tell a traveler to stay at this hotel, but I would also tell you to keep a close eye on your valuables!

Reviews.Title: “Good & bad, you decide...”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel999
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 411... Pros: Great hotel if you are going to the races, right next door. I could see the cars running the track from my window. I reserved a king room for one night...I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the door and had been given a king junior suite. Very spacious, comfortable, and ample lighting. Plenty of outlets to plug in computer and cell phones. Heat/air controlled by a wall thermostat so the room was a constant temperature. The hotel overall is very inviting and clean. There is a separate bar that is open after 5pm except for Sundays, I didn't venture in there. Other than that...it is pretty much your normal hilton garden inn. There is an Olive Garden next door and plenty of restaurants within a short drive. Very convenient to the airport (also has a free shuttle). Cons: The bathtub had been resurfaced in the past and the "painted" layer was peeling off..very unappealing and had to pick pieces out of the tub before I showered. There were also a few hairs in the tub (gross). When I woke up the morning, there were very tiny ants in the sink and a few on the tile floor...The hallway near the elevator had weird smell..couldn't put my finger on it. I probably would stay here again if the need arose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you're in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Ghawell99
Reviews.Content: Road Warrior that seeks a comfortable bed, clean room/hotel and peace - Visit Daytona Beach on business and stayed here for "2 weeks". The location is great, across the street from a Major Shopping Mall and major shopping stores. Major Restaruants are within walking distances and highway access is nearby. The overall area is a fairly good area and appears to be safe. The hotel exterior is clean and appealing. The interior lobby is nicely decorated and the kitchen/dining are clean. The pool was cleaned every Monday on the clock that was great. Located near the airport, but don’t let this keep you from staying there. For some reason you don't hear the airplane noise. Now to the staff, friendly and helpful. The only thing that is that the older desk clerk doesn't greet you going in or out. Which doesn’t make any different. Want stop a stay there at all. The younger lady speaks and greets. Now to the room. The room was excellent; clean clean clean, the bed was a little hard at first but after a careful look at the mattress it has a dial on the side and you can adjust the bed to your comfort. That problem was solved with a dial. Pillows were okay. The room was a suite and was "extremely" nice. Equip with a fridge, microwave, sink and etc. The room was facing the front of the hotel overlooking the pool and on the top floor- corner room. It was quiet and peaceful no kidding. Regarding the maids they was nice and cleaned the room as if it was as if walked in the first day. Maids working in hall didn't hear them, no yelling and conversing in the halls. No bumping and hitting walls when cleaning. Just In case there was a do not disturb sign on the door. The breakfast was good and the selection was okay. It’s not near the beach but it’s worth every Penny. I would stay in this hotel again and again. This manager runs this one right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tmbevtfd
Reviews.Content: Myself and two other guys grabbed this hotel late in the game for the last weekend of Bike Week, 2012. About $300 a night for a suite. That's not too bad for three people, $100 each. The hotel was excellent, very clean, nice staff, accommodating atmosphere. For those who aren't familiar with Daytona, the racetrack is only about 2.5 miles inland from the actual "beach." And this hotel is the next property East of the racetrack. I could clearly see the track from our room window. Really nice place, we'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SCShaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights immediately after the Daytona 500 was supposed to end. The race was delayed by rain and we were able to walk across the street and see the race on Monday night rather than the scheduled Sunday. We mostly enjoyed the hotel. It was quite clean and the proximity to the race was a huge plus. Housekeeping did a great job and the front desk staff were helpful and courteous. We had a junior suite, which was spacious with 2 TVs and a nice sitting area. My disappointment was with the bed. Hilton Garden advertises their adjustable beds as one big reason to stay with them. We were extremely unhappy with the bed. I had set both adjustments on firm, as that's what we like. However the bed was lumpy and sagged in the middle. Maybe they are getting close to needing to replace the matress, but with their advertising focusing on bed comfort, we were unhappy with our experience. With a better matress, I would rate this place excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hilton Garden Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Disneygirl1959
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay at this Hilton Garden Inn was February 16 - 17, 2012. This Hilton is excellent for travellers as it is located at the entrance to the Daytona Beach airport and very close to I-95. The Volusia Mall is located across the way and from the higher floors on the front of the hotel you can see directly into the track at Daytona International Speedway! The front desk personnel are friendly and accommodating and it has a lovely entrance and reception area. Guest rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are very comfortable. A small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker are provided in each room which is most convenient. Complimentary bottled water is offered upon check-in, along with fresh baked cookies and lemonade in the evening. We stay at this location 3 - 4 times a year and have never been disappointed. Parking is abundant and well-lighted at night. We highly recommend this location as we have consistently had very good experiences here.

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Wedding Experience Feel Even More Special”
Reviews.Author: clvanson
Reviews.Content: I wish I had known about TripAdvisor last year when my son got married, because I would have loved to have been able to name each staff person that made our stay so special. We stayed, at my son's suggestion, at the Hilton Garden Inn Daytona Beach Airport from April 13 through the 17th, 2011. The location is great; right near the airport, across from the Volusia Mall, main arteries are easily accessible, and the Daytona Speedway is right around the corner. Back to the hotel. The staff was so sincere and friendly from the moment we got there to the moment we left and went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable and made each of us feel special. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The group of us who stayed there have already decided it will be our hotel of choice on our next visit to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - nice airport option”
Reviews.Author: bk_t1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the final night of a trip, to be close to the airport. The location is across the street from the speedway and 2 minutes drive to the airport. It is very convenient to the mall and an assortment of restaurants. There is also room service at reasonable prices. The room was large (an accessible room), huge bedroom area (adjustable softness bed), large bath, and a sitting area. 2 flat panel TV's and free wifi with good signal. The breakfast in the morning (elite benefit) was good and there is an eggs made-to-order cook. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best in class service”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, good services, and Very professional staff. Courtney specifically was extremely friendly and we are very greatful for the warm reception and assurance of a pleasant stay. I will come back next time we travel through. Thank you Courtney.. You are the bomb!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, pleasant Staff, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: DebJ14
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the HIlton Garden Inn Daytona Beach Airport location Dec 25-30 2011. I arrived around 9:30pm and was greeted with a smile. Check in was fast and I was soon on my way to my King Junior Suite (RM 527). I booked the Bed and Breakfast Package since it was only $5.00 more than the room only. I read other reviews about the front desk staff being unhelpful. I found them extremely helpful. In fact one evening I needed to carry in some heavy boxes and the luggage carts were all in use. One of the ladies at the desk offered to help me and she carried in a box from my car. They were also very helpful providing directions and restaurant suggestions. They definitely went above and beyone The room was large with a TV in the bedroom area and in the Living room area. The bathroom was basic, but spotless and there were plenty of towels. Everything in the room was in working order and Housekeeping made up the room prior to noon each day. The bed was super comfortable - soft sheets and you can adjust the firmness on the mattress. Although the airport is close to the airport terminal and the busy International Speedway Blvd. the room was absolutely quiet. I ate the cooked to order eggs every morning. The cooks and servers were all very pleasant and service was prompt and the eggs were cooked exactly as I like them. I would recommend buying the bed and breakfast since the cost of the buffet is $9.95 per person. The package is a much better deal. The best thing about the hotel was the free in room WIFI and the Business Center off the lobby. The Business Center had a combo fax/copy machine and there was no charge for faxing or making copies. The computers in the business center were fast and there were no problems printing from them. There was no additonal charge for printing. The pool looked inviting, but I had no time for relaxation on this trip and a cold front came through. Zip check out made leaving the hotel a breeze. I just dropped off the keycards at the desk. Having the pantry available by the front desk was also a great convenience. It was nice that you could also buy beer and wine there too. I did not use the bar area, but it looked nice and there were people there every evening. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I am in Daytona on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: olimpiu
Reviews.Content: Great bad, nice room overpriced breakfast. Worth staying here but not breakfast. I get to see daytona's race track from my window.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Celeste P
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about The Hilton Garden Inn Daytona Beach .On a recent trip to Daytona Beach to move our daughter into Embry Riddle we reserved a room at The Hilton Garden Inn. We were greeted by a very friendly and more than accommodating staff member at check-in and after traveling 17 hours by car to get there this was very comforting! Speaking of comfort, we were upgraded to a beautiful junior suite with the most amazingly comfortable bed we ever slept in! The room was very spacious and immaculate! All of our questions and requests were addressed with a smile and the utmost professionalism! On top of all that we got a discount for being members of the Embry Riddle family....great perk! We will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we are in town and highly recommend the Hilton Garden Inn to anyone traveling to Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Rude”
Reviews.Author: Hotelgirly84
Reviews.Content: I walked into this hotel in the afternoon to book a room for the night. I was traveling from Orlando and did not want to drive back that evening but instead rather spend the night out. I went up to inquire about a room night and the front desk associate Cadalia was very short with me. When I inquired about a specific rate she stated "No" to inform me that it was not available. I asked if I could speak with a manager and again she informed me "Nope" with a nasty attitude. I understand things won't always be available and that the answer cannot always be Yes but the tone and body language of this associate screamed that she was not willing to work with my needs as a guest. I work in hospitality and am a manager at a hotel. I would never allow my associates to speak to guests this way. Instead of speaking with her to look into other rates I determined that I would never stay at this property and instead decided to find alternate accommodations where I would not be treated so rudely at the first moment. I often recommend hotels to guests traveling to Daytona from Orlando and I will be sure to insist that my guests do not stay here simply because the attitude of the front desk staff generally speaks for the level of management they have running the hotel and how the property will operate as a whole. I hope they are able to change this attitude quick or they will be in for a rude awakening when more and more people walk away based on her body language and tone.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: number2cac
Reviews.Content: I was put in this Hilton Garden Inn by a company. I don't usually stay with this chain because the price of breakfast is ridiculous. However, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable and clean(yay for all Hilton family beds!), and it was convenient to everything in Daytona Beach but the actual beach. It felt very new. I would highly recommend this hotel for those that want to be near the airport/racetrack/Embry Riddle.

Reviews.Title: “Get Place to stay after a Day at the beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: Djwana
Reviews.Content: We were on our way back from Orlando- Disney to be specific- and decided to stop in Daytona Beach to let our 4 year old see the ocean. Well after getting there of course he wanted to get in the water and sand sand eerywhere. To make a long story short- we decided to spend the night in Daytona and this hotel was aailable. The serive was awesome. I was greeted with such pleasure and given bottles of cold water and fresh baked cookies. The entrance was so beautiful-it was like welcome home- especially because were so dirty from being at the beach. We stepped into an immaculate room- big open space especially with an ACTIVE 4 year old. It was so nice- we relaxed the remainder of the evening -We could have spent the entire day in that bed, what a great night sleep- we wanted to take the bed home with us! We woke up to an exceptional breakfast buffet- grits, eggs, bacon, sausage, made to order omelets and belgian waffles, and other great varieties of foods. The cook was great-I can't recall his name but my husband gave him a tip- he said that was the best omelet he had in a very long time.The chef worked on Sunday, July 24, 2011 for breakfast. I say this because one of the other guests said that the chef on the previous morning did not know how to cook.It was definitely a great ending to our family vacation!!! We will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but dont bother going to Lounge Female Bar Tenders control the TV!”
Reviews.Author: jpmoney
Reviews.Content: This annoyed me so much i had to write a review. This is a nice Hotel, however, I went to the Lounge 2 nights in a row to watch the NBA finals and the bartenders would not consider changing the channel from "Dancing with the Stars". There was a full bar and we were told to go watch an old TV on the other side of the room. Bar stools are limited but they had no problem using one of them to sit and watch there show. God forbid you need a drink and have to interupt there show!! I was ready to spend some money and watch the game but wound up going back to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: buffy333Florida
Reviews.Content: What an awsome hotel and #1 staff. The rooms were large, clean and beds were excellent. The breakfast was "the best". Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for business”
Reviews.Author: finallytravelling45
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel every week last year and the reason I did was the front desk staff. The always welcomed me and made me confortable. I recently stayed there again after a long time. The staff remembered and welcomed me back. They recently renovated and the rooms are very nice. The room service staff was very pleasant and wanted to make sure everything was to my liking. The chef in the morning is always pleasant and welcomes me back. The morning waitstaff are not the most accomodating but it's just breakfast. The treadmills in the fitness center are always working (which is hard to come by these days). The reason I will continue going back is that they make me confortable when I have to be away from home and that to me is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “So nice and clean ! Staff so kind. Very nice place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Stoplicking
Reviews.Content: Such a clean and well kept place to stay! So happy we stayed here ! Highly recommend for all ! You ask and they will take care of you promptly . Will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs to be Retrained”
Reviews.Author: OnlyNickki
Reviews.Content: I liked my room. The usual Hilton Garden Inn. Nothing more nothing less. The staff however, was not very helpful. They seemed almost rude at times. I recommend staying at another location. Perhaps Palm Coast? The staff there is Very helpful and I believe it is a newer location within 30mins of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, But it's worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: diner612
Reviews.Content: We stayed over night and everything seemed fine. I was a little shocked at the bill with all the taxes and local fees and what not. Almost $200 a night I would expect a little more than what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “quiet haven, great bedding, clean, kind staff - -A+ !”
Reviews.Author: Farmerinthedell3
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to another part of Florida for Spring Break this week and got rerouted through Daytona Beach after a loooong day at ATL... we needed a place to crash and didnt need to be on the beach; this hotel offered a free airport shuttle and the Hilton name. After that , you know its a crapshoot, still, in this day and age of service ' whenever' and 'whatever'. .. Well, from the first time I connected to the hotel via the Delta helpline for messed-up travelers it was clear we would have a good experience. Room was reasonably priced, lobby was well appointed; by the time we got to the hotel via free shuttle from the airport that came immediately after we called, it was too late for room service. The lobby pantry / provisions area had food, drink and even beer available for purchase to microwave in your room or tide us over til breakfast. Yes it was kind of pricy but we just chose wisely and was grateful for the convenience. The room itself was just a 2 queen but had nice duvets, great pillows and was quiet. Maybe being near the airport and not on the spring-break beach was a factor, I dont know, I was just really thankful for the serenity. The breakfast was not included in our room rate, but cost only $8-something for adults and $4-something for children under 12. I couldn't have eaten anywhere in town for that price, for the selection and quality ( and quantity ) of food on offer. Eggs cooked to order, nice sausage, bacon, french toast, pancakes, waffles, cereals, juices pastry fruit etc etc etc . Staff was kind and attentive throughout our stay ...but the kitchen chefs/cooks really impressed me. They didnt act like they were just cooking food and slinging hash - they wanted to make sure what you ordered met your expectations, was enough or not too much. The breakfast experience really topped off a great stay after a crummy travel day. Desk staff made sure we were comfortable and offered some extra assistance on a nighttime lost-luggage-return run. A swim in the morning and a quick look in the gym found more tidy cleanliness and care for the facility. Our kudos to the team, and we'll consider Daytona Beach for a non-accidental trip in the future in order to enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: patandfiona
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in November. Loved this hotel. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite with whirlpool bath. The staff were lovely in this hotel. They could not do enough for us. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and are planning to return here in March 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean and modern building”
Reviews.Author: Regular_Traveler_7
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently on business. I've tried a lot of other area hotels and think this is the best in Daytona for quality versus price. They have all the expected conveniences: in-room fridge, microwave, coffee, plus the lobby area has a restaurant, "convenience store," and a bar/lounge down the hall. It's next to a mall and near fast food. I'd give it five stars if the breakfast buffet were free, though the prices are okay and it is larger than most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: If you don't need to stay on the beach this hotel is just perfect. Was there for a week of work. Very clean, good service, completely wireless. Nice pool/hot tub area, small gym, laundry all well kept. Breakfast and dinner served (just had breakfast, very good). Cookies at the front desk every night. Just a delight all around.

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: flafoodlovers
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! It was absolutely the cleanest hotel we've ever stayed in. The room was beautiful and extremely quiet- there was almost no external noise heard. The staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating. They offer the best breakfast buffet we've ever seen and at a price you would expect at a Denny's. There was a chef who would cook your eggs/omelettes to order and there was anything imaginable you could think of in addition. Computers are available for guests to use and the hotel is conveniently located near the Speedway, Airport, Volusia Mall, and many restaurants. We will absolutely stay here again and highly recommend it. Well worth a few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks!”
Reviews.Author: Longun
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled to the hilton garden inn from the uk for a 15 day light aircraft flying trip out of ormond beach. I chose this hotel after searching the internet for weeks to find an acceptable place to stay. But what we got was more than just acceptable...... It was fantastic! After having a 3 hour drive and arriving late at the hotel (i rang and notified them on the way) the hotel staff at reception were fast, efficient, polite and a pleasure to deal with. Then more excellence from the room..... It was very clean with a large tv, comfortable beds a large floor space and bathroom all in very good condition. After a good nights sleep we thought we'd try out the breakfast and again not a problem. The menu of the hotel restaurant had enough on it to keep us happy the whole trip! (sundays its closed) We tried nearly everything on the menu which was very well cooked and presented (the gulf grouper was my personal favorite) This hotel is a must if you want to stay in the daytona area.... Thank you hilton gardens!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the finest Mainland hotel for business & Pleasure. Service was great, Suites are well appointed, and the lounge and landscaping are incredible

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Daytona Beach Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 189 Midway Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32114
